case_vignette: A 5-year-old girl is brought to the physician because of watery discharge from her right eye for 2 weeks. She and her parents, who are refugees from Sudan, arrived in Texas a month ago. Her immunization status is not known. She is at the 25th percentile for weight and the 50th percentile for height. Her temperature is 37.2°C (99°F), pulse is 90/min, and respirations are 18/min. Examination of the right eye shows matting of the eyelashes. Everting the right eyelid shows hyperemia, follicles, and papillae on the upper tarsal conjunctiva. Slit-lamp examination of the right eye shows follicles in the limbic region and the bulbar conjunctiva. There is corneal haziness with neovascularization at the 12 o'clock position. Examination of the left eye is unremarkable. Direct opthalmoscopy of both eyes shows no abnormalities. Right pre-auricular lymphadenopathy is present.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have watery discharge from my right eye for two weeks.
Have you experienced any redness, pain, or vision changes in the affected eye?
My right eye eyelid is red and has some bumps, and my vision is a bit cloudy.
Have you been in contact with anyone with similar symptoms, or have you had any recent upper respiratory infections?
No, I haven't been in contact with anyone with similar symptoms or had any upper respiratory infections.
Do you have any itching or a history of allergies?
No, I haven't mentioned any itching or a history of allergies.
Have you noticed any fever, swollen lymph nodes, or general malaise along with your eye symptoms?
I have a slightly elevated temperature and swelling in front of my right ear.
Have you experienced any ear pain, hearing changes, or sensation changes on the face?
No, I haven't had any ear pain, changes in hearing, or changes in sensation on my face.
Are the bumps on your eyelid localized to one area, and are they filled with fluid or pus?
The bumps are on the inside of my right upper eyelid, but I haven't mentioned if they are filled with fluid or pus.
Is the discharge from your eye clear and watery or thick and colored?
The discharge from my eye is watery.
Have you had any previous eye infections, surgeries, or trauma to the eye?
I haven't mentioned having any previous eye infections, surgeries, or trauma to the eye.
Final Diagnosis: Preseptal (periorbital) cellulitis with conjunctivitis.
